sepa_weekend:
ğŸ“¬ Your Latest (current) Deposit

Your deposit has not yet arrived at DFX?
If your current transfer was sent on Friday or during the weekend, it has not arrived at DFX yet â€” and it also does not necessarily have to arrive on Monday.

This is totally normal for SEPA transfers sent at the end of the week.

---

ğŸŒ SEPA Standard Processing Times

Bank transfers have different processing times until they arrive at DFX:

ğŸŸ¢ Working days (during the day): on average 3â€“5 hours
ğŸŸ¡ Working days (afternoon): usually the next working day
ğŸŸ  Holidays: usually the next working day
ğŸ”´ Weekends: at the beginning of the next week, usually on Monday â¬…ï¸

---

âš ï¸ Important Information About Mondays

Banks have their highest workload on Mondays.
Everything that arrives from Friday afternoon onward is added to Mondayâ€™s queue. â˜ï¸

Because of this, not all transfers are processed on Monday â€” some are delayed until Tuesday. ğŸ˜³

In extreme cases, a transfer sent on Friday afternoon may not arrive until Tuesday of the following week.
â€¼ï¸ This is not unusual for weekend transfers â€” it happens regularly.
